org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.axis
Class RangeAxis

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.axis.ValueAxis
      org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.axis.RangeAxis
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.timepedia.exporter.client.Exportable
public class RangeAxis
extends ValueAxis
implements org.timepedia.exporter.client.Exportable

A RangeAxis is an ValueAxis that represents values, typically on the y-axis.

Method Detail

calcPrctDiff

public static double calcPrctDiff(double v1,
                                  double v2)
Calculates the percentage difference from value v1 to value v2. For example, if v1 = 10 and v2 = 15, then the % difference is 50% ( 15.0/10.0 - 1.0 )

focus

public void focus()
Make this range axis the current focus. Has not effect the plot has multi-axis set to true. Otherwise, this axis becomes the primary left axis displayed.

setAllowAutoScale

public void setAllowAutoScale(boolean allowAutoScale)
If set to true, allow axis ticks to be scaled automatically by powers of thousand if they exceeed maxDigits settings. For example, if max digits is 4, then the number 25000 will be rendered as 25, and the axis label will be modified to include the word "Thousands". setAllowScientificNotation() will override this and take priority, as well as setScale().

setAllowScientificNotation

public void setAllowScientificNotation(boolean enable)
If enabled (true by default), when maxTickLabelDigits is exceeded, labels will be rendered in scientific notation.

setAutoZoomVisibleRange

public void setAutoZoomVisibleRange(boolean autoZoom)

setAxisIndex

public void setAxisIndex(int axisIndex)

setAxisPanel

public void setAxisPanel(RangeAxisPanel r)

setCalcRangeAsPercent

public void setCalcRangeAsPercent(boolean b)
Setting to true will cause all of the range-Y values to be converted to a percentage increase/decrease from some reference range-Y value (either the first datapoint of the dataset or the leftmost datapoint that's visible in the plot).

setForceScientificNotation

public void setForceScientificNotation(boolean force)
Force tick labels to always be rendered in scientific notation. (Default false);
